title: How to cover songs on YouTube without showing my face - Quora

response.answer_text: I can tell you how I do YouTube videos on my MacBook Pro. I get whatever image I want to use (it can be a still or a video.) Then I record my song (I use Apple GarageBand DAW.) I go into iMovie and build a video, importing my image by drag and drop, the same with my audio track. There it is possible to manipulate the video by fading to black at the end or any number of effects. I then hit export to YouTube and it’s done. No worries about my face. I don’t know if you can do that with an iPh0ne or any other phone, I always use a computer. There are audio and video apps you can get for Windows, too. To get yourself out of the picture simply you could just angle the camera (or phone) so that your face is not shown, just your instrument and hands. That is the simplest way and I have seen many such “cover” songs presented like that. I don’t think anybody cares what you look like anyway.

sure, you can always use images to use for animations or cartoons instead…I did it for plenty of songs that I sang myself without showing my face… I used photoshop to make the images and then “movie maker “ to make the video and put the audio with it.   this second song has one million views, so it’s possible to make a video without showing your face that people will watch. : )
